awd_titl_txt: Friction of Granular Soil Along an Interface
awd_abstract_narration: The project aims at the study of the friction mechanism of                      particles along an interface with a solid body by                               conducting theoretical and experimental work. The                               theoretical work is based on a mechanical (S.G.-Sphere-in-                      the-Groove) model of a single particle . The experimental                       work entails building two testing apparatuses. One will                         utilize photoelastic ideal particles to study the                               interparticle and interface/particle contacts. The other                        apparatus will study the friction between ideal particles                       and natural sands along interfaces of controlled roughness.                     The experimental and theoretical work will then be                              incorporated to predict friction coefficient of granular                        soil .
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation

inst.inst_name: University of Massachusetts Lowell Research Foundation
